> <OLD>
>
> Tucson looks back at Guiledart and snakes the tip of his tail over his
> cannon in a sinisterly, playful manner.  He then retracts his tail and
> snakes it tauntingly over Hard Head and Hydra's weapons.  If he wanted to he
> could snap his tail and cause them to drop their weapons but he decides just
> to have a little fun with the trio instead.
>
> " Energy weapons will only take you so far.  Now, if I wanted to, I could
> constrict your weapons to the point of implosion, just with a coil of my
> tail but, I think I'll be nice this time and spare you all the humility. I
> wouldn't want you to look bad around your master would I?  But how fun it
> would be to sssstrangle all of you in the coils of my tail."
>
> He talks with a chilling hiss in his voice.  He knew that a little theatrics
> went a long way.  When in doubt play the part of a beast that is commonly
> feared for his predatory nature.  It was definitely not in his character but
> he knew he had to step outside the box this time.  Everyone depended on him,
> and he wasn't about to let anyone down.
>
> Along the way, he comes across a piece of metal on the ground.  It gets
> caught in his tail which coils around it, breaking it into tiny pieces,

<NEW>

GUILEDART just looked at TUSCON as if he were daft, as if inwardly
wondering if his master hadn't made some impossible mistake in letting
this maxial into the games. He shook his head as they walked.

HARDHEAD and HYDRA watched as TUSCON snapped the metal object with his
tail, there was a glaring at the discarded metal fragments.

GUILEDART and his men finally brought TUSCON to a much lower level of
the facility, here the walls were still metallic, their cut and
disigned was for strength and endurance. The butressing beams that
helped the already thick bulkheads were thick and powerful as they ran
from floor to cieling, spaced about 20 feet apart they were each
almost 5 feet thick. From the curve of the walls and the butressing it
resmbled more of a ship then a base, but if it was, it must be huge as
the lift they were on had come down several levels.

GUILEDART walked TUSCON past a guard station and into an area which
resembled a prison.

As the guards let them past they walked past cells, inside there were
creatures of all different types. The front of the cells had duranium
bars coupled with a shield to keep anyone from breaking through. The
air smelled dank, like bodilly waste, rust and motor oil as well as
seveal other unidentifiable odors.

As GUILEDART led TUSCON down the long line of cells different
creatures came to the front of their cells and started whistling and
calling out to TUSCOn, most jeering at him.

"Fresh meat!" One yelled.

"Ready for the scrap heap!" Yelled another.

GUILEDART just walked on leading TUSCON, with HARDHEAD and HYDRA
bringing up the rear. They past different sets of guards as they
walked.

(TAG)

Preston
